subtopics.name: Sensory Experience
subtopics.description: Direct perception through our physical senses, forming the raw material of empirical knowledge and the foundation for how we interface with objective reality. This represents our most immediate and unmediated form of knowing.

subtopics.name: Observational Evidence
subtopics.description: Systematic documentation and analysis of phenomena, including both natural observation and controlled experimentation. This bridges pure sensation with structured understanding through methodical investigation.

subtopics.name: Pattern Recognition
subtopics.description: The cognitive process of identifying regularities and relationships in empirical data, allowing us to move from isolated observations to predictive understanding of how reality behaves.

subtopics.name: Experiential Verification
subtopics.description: The testing and validation of empirical claims through repeated observation and practical experience, establishing reliability and consistency in our understanding of reality.
